intro: Aeschynanthus austroyunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan flame flower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, with opposite, ovate leaves that are glossy in appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
